edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL

Class InterfaceGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL.InterfaceGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class InterfaceGUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The Graphical user interface will promptly load up the graphics in this game, or what was done. Game will loas a JFrame, and provide a JPanel that is used to develop the 9 X 9 grid. the Interface will then act as a key listener, which will allow the player to use keys to move and attack and look around for the document.
    Author:
    Mario Garcia, Anuja Joshi, Michelle Duong, Matthew Musquiz, Kristin Adachi

    • Field Summary

      the engine is what starts the game off.
      private javax.swing.JFrame f
      The main frame that will pop up as a window.
      private javax.swing.JPanel HUD
      The heads up display that will be displayed on the bottom of the window of the game.
      private javax.swing.JPanel panel
      The panel that will house the JLabels from the game engine.
      private SaveLoad saveLoad
      The save and load object that will be used to save and load the files that are in progress by the user.

    • Field Detail

      • engine

        private Engine engine
        the engine is what starts the game off. This will be used in order to obtain information that the game will manipulate and send back to the interface for displaying.

      • saveLoad

        private SaveLoad saveLoad
        The save and load object that will be used to save and load the files that are in progress by the user.

      • panel

        private javax.swing.JPanel panel
        The panel that will house the JLabels from the game engine. This will also set all of the images into a 9 X 9 grid.

      • HUD

        private javax.swing.JPanel HUD
        The heads up display that will be displayed on the bottom of the window of the game.

      • f

        private javax.swing.JFrame f
        The main frame that will pop up as a window. This frame is to be displaying everything that the user interface throws at it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InterfaceGUI

        public InterfaceGUI()

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(int number)
        Paints the display of the world, the 9 X 9 grid, which is determined by the locations of each enemy, room, power up, and player.
        Parameters:
        number - - the input that the user specifies. Used for the look method.

      • debugPaint

        public void debugPaint(int number)
        Prints the debug version of the display, which so to speak is the mode used to debug the system. This will reveal all enemies and power ups.
        Parameters:
        number - - the number that the player inputs in order to look around.

      • play

        public void play()
        Will start the game up, creates the JFrame and what is inside of it; the grid, the Heads Up Display, the panel, the menu bar and so on.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Key events used in this method allow for the interaction of the game within it. This is done by adding in a key listener into the JFrame in order to take input from the user.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • setHUD

        public void setHUD()
        The Heads Up Display. This is used for the user to see their current status in the game. This HUD will display the number of bullets currently, how many lives the player has, the current level, and how many turns of invincibility the player has.
